entry.title: Leading Armenian mobile network operator takes stake in Georgia: Business Week Armenia

media:group.media:title: Leading Armenian mobile network operator takes stake in Georgia: Business Week Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìçTeam Telecom, one of Armenia‚Äôs leading mobile network operators, struck a deal to take a 30% stake in the Georgian telecommunications company SkyTel. üìçThe owner of Sotk, Armenia‚Äôs largest gold mine, indefinitely suspended operations due to cross-border fire from Azerbaijan. üìçArmenia will appoint trade representatives to China, Germany, and the United States, more than doubling the country‚Äôs number of commercial envoys overseas. üìçArmenia said nearly half of last year‚Äôs record economic growth could be attributed solely to ‚ÄúRussia-related factors.‚Äù

entry.title: Pashinyan-Aliyev talks in Moldova end without agreement

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan-Aliyev talks in Moldova end without agreement
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs latest round of peace talks with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in Moldova ended without any new agreements reached. üìçPashinyan and Aliyev are set to hold a follow-up meeting in Brussels on July 21.
